messages.content: that's what testnet's for
bittensor subnets are supposed to be self regulating markets. your solution's too bad = you drop out. you're trying to make it into  something else entirely
I agree with you on that. If someone better than you comes and join he will throw you out. But if this person adds a clone of the same strategy, then it is unfair.

what if i want to test two different strategies? I have to buy two servers now or use a vpn, and i have to have a second coldkey. to what end? that's just extra op-cost. people who want to clone will be mildly hindered. people who want to do useful stuff will be annoyed and disincentivized.

Yes we are familiar with that possibility as well. However tweaking the same models is not considered a different strategy. We want to give you the ability to do these kind of changes on the running strategy. 

So yes if you have a genuinely different strategy, you will need a new vm indeed, but you will also have to consider the extra cost of your models in the new strategy, which is probably way higher than the cost of a cloud vm these days.

What constitutes a "different" strategy?

If someone starts from the "default" miners and slowly improves it, when does it reach an "acceptable" difference level for you? The strategies tend to converge, they all try to hit the best *possible* (not some imaginary) predictions after all, and by definition they should get more and more similar as they improve. What if different miners decide to use the best data sources and models they could find, but get unlucky, because others use similar setups and will have "too correlated" answers? Will the core responsibly of miner be "randomizing" edges of the answers to be considered independent?

Do you really see an endgame here, or just throw it out and see what happens? I don't see how your goal can be reached without major hit to the network

I am sorry for the AION holders as well. They're promised live vaults any day now, but at the same time, you constantly derail miners making them focus on non-trivial but unimportant work, while forcing them to cut costs wherever possible. I wonder if you could find any miner who can agree with you that their predictions will not get worse thanks to this. You can tweak accuracy on the main page as much as you want, it's all fake anyway, as you're measured and graded on your own questions... but the real accuracy is what should matter. On randomly selected and rated question and markets. You'll see then that this is no good.

Hello and thanks for your message.

The "default" miner as you call it (the one on the public repo) , is a miner that is not performing well nowadays. Our current miners have outperformed this and we are very happy that this is happening.  Of course start improving this miner will be more doable with less copy miners as you realize. 

Of course it is the best approach to hunt the best sources and use the best models possible for your miners, but the problem with your argument is that if 2 people do that, they will end up with the same miner. The only way what you suggest can happen, is either if you are confidently wrong on everything (in which case you receive nothing either way), or being confidently correct on everything. If you think you are in the second category -having a 100% accurate miner-, I would suggest you to sell your algorithm to Citadel or Jane street for a few billions. Is way more profitable than our subnet. 

Also I am not really getting why you are fighting so much a change which is clearly trying to prevent people from doing copies and focus on model/algorithms improvement. The endgoal you mention here is that the idea of cloning your strategy should be non-profitable.  You are fighting this change in a way that would make me think that you are somehow exploiting this for your own profit. 

Also about the AION, you are in the server with you other account, you can read all our announcements and find your answers. All our vault updates are there.

Finally, a lot of the changes we do are based on miners feedback. So if you want to suggest something that will help miners improve their forecasters,  you can message us your suggestion and we will consider it if it makes sense.
At what treshold strategy will be considered non-duplicate to be deserving to exist, and not being  banned?
By adding more diversity to miners you want to achive a thing, where aggregate of all opinions gives the best result? in the form of community miner?

I am sure there are matematicians who can agree to it, and prove it. I have experimental data to proove it as well.
Bur, also, my experiments show that after some very limited amount of adding individual strategies to the bagging algorithm comes saturation and score stops improving

Hey Antra! 

I would say the first goal here is to make the game more fair for everyone. Community miner could be improved as you say, but this is more like a side effect of making the subnet fair and more attractive to good forecasters.

The fair work initiative is good, but the approach is very primitive and will not give any result, do you really think that a miner who has configured effective models will not be able to connect 10 IP addresses to 1 server and distribute the work? this is stupid), if you are serious about implementing fair work, then it is worth moving on to more effective identification methods based on the features of strategies and models.

Hello! You are absolutely right. We do expect that some miners will try to bypass this. We plan to introduce more changes in the coming weeks, that will identify copies in a more robust way than a naive ip/coldkey matching. It will be a combination of measures that will address the problem. We just release everything gradually so we can better evaluate the impact of our changes.
Will your changes be directed to incentivise more unique strategies, or to limit 1 player by 1 strategy?
Hello! First one. If a miner can support different strategies he is more than welcome to deploy them.
Right now there is 172 unique coldkey in subnet, and 117 unique IPs. But since there are only few players, this change with IPs or coldkey did barely nothing.
Except of punishing those, who did not prepare in front. I knew about this change, you told about it before. But I did not believe it would be done because it seemed so uneffective and unbelievable
If you really want unique strategies you need to introduce new changes quickly, those 2 did not work
As I mention above, it will be a combination of measures. It would be very amateur if we deployed everything at once.
In 1-2 days there will be as many ips as there are coldkey, and in a wekk all of them will beunique
Just a bit of patience 🙂

By telling that "new changes" will be introduced and not specifying them you create situation of unsertainity. But why?

You are telling - concentrate on your algo, have only 1 miner, but at the same time you just making things harder for this 1 miner to compete. There are many mining miners in the leaderborad right now, and their predictions are still the same and performance very similar. Having 1 miner, event after youhave  introduced you current changes is not enough. 

Big players will find a way to go around your limitations anyway, and for small miners there is no chance because they will have to compete in the infra side at the same time.
I bet: you will have  internal api, which validators will use to determine which miners should be shadow-banned
Because there may not be open-source unique strategy criteria, **that is not possible to go around**

We did not announce details because we are not sure of them yet ourselves. Currently we are experimenting with a few ways. Like the ip uniqueness, when we know that we will introduce a change we will announce. If I can give you a hint about your bet, dont put money on it you will lose them 🙂

I see the big picture, having one miner earn as much as you would with 140 of them, opening up slots for potential competition.
But I don't see the way I could explore several potential solutions at a time.
I should be able to expose multiple endpoints in my solo miner that each answer the question differently, and have some scoring algorithm take that into account. I should be free to explore different strategies and models to see which one performs the best, be penalized for wrong answers and rewarded for correct ones, verifying my strategy and making my miner more stable and less likely to dereg, without having all that operational overhead with IP and coldkey duplication, and at the same time giving room for competition to do the same.

Hello! The problem you describe is a "fine-tuning" problem. He have no intention  of stopping miners from doing it, that would be absurd. We just want to re-direct this from spam registrations, because they are not healthy for the subnet to occupy slots with just the same strategy, but barely different. 

That being  said, we are also happy to hear your suggestions on how we could provide you more information and tools that will help you improve your models
You can add a bit more clarify for LLM resolver algorithm, or open source code so that we can account for its limitations

Not only finetuning but also exploring completely different strategies altogether. I might base one of my solutions on gpt 4.5 and another on analytical math (e.g. for stock questions), and other resolvers, so ideally I'd be able to explore **multiple ideas at once** using **just one miner**

Hey Antra I think we have discussed this in the past. Is just a a combination of different llm models. And thanks to you we identified some wrongs, and we assigned engineers to try and improve the situation.
Yes, this is what we want to achieve. Give you the space to explore different strategies through your 1 miner.
this would also solve the duplicate problem automatically, since it would be no longer profitable to have more than one miner. you wouldn't even need safeguards against it

And also you could still deploy more than 1 if you can support them. But the experimentation of every strategy, should be done under the same miner, because we beleive is better for you as well. Is much easier to collect data and create analytics when you have all your data as a long time-series .

> This is what we want to achieve.
Ok cool scoring update to allow multiple endpoints on single miner when
I mean, fix the incorrect resolves first, then that
I am not sure if a multiple endpoints miner is something we will try in the very near future, but is definitely a descent idea we haven't think and we can try to explore.

**A new inference enters the Silicon Crowd.**

We’re partnering with lightningrod.ai, a forecasting lab pioneering reinforcement learning for real-world truth discovery. 

Their latest paper demonstrates how outcome-based reinforcement learning can fine-tune small-scale LLMs into powerful forecasters, not just matching frontier models on accuracy, but exceeding them in calibration and market profitability. Their approach leverages Group-Relative Policy Optimisation (GRPO) and ReMax, refined for noisy, binary reward signals: the exact terrain prediction markets live in.

**Why it matters:**
Lightning Rod’s inference models will soon operate inside Subnet 6, learning from 110,000+ real-world events, training on temporally consistent synthetic data, and shaping the future of verifiable intelligence in forecasting.

Their calibration edge isn’t theoretical, it translates to economic value. And in the Infinite Game, calibrated intelligence becomes liquidity.

They are early, and experimental. But their research sets a foundation for what AI-native forecasting might become.

//-

Will the June 2025 U.S. Employment Report, released on July 5, 2025, show nonfarm payroll growth between 100,000 and 180,000 and an unemployment rate at or below 4.3%? ==Further Information==: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics is scheduled to release the June 2025 Employment Situation Summary on July 5, 2025. This question resolves to 'Yes' if the official report shows nonfarm payroll employment increased by at least 100,000 but no more than 180,000 jobs (inclusive), and the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate is 4.3% or lower. If either condition is not met, the question resolves to 'No.'

Information validity period: 2025-07-05 00:00:00 UTC to 2025-07-10 23:59:59 UTC.

___ 
Question was asked on July 8, for report released on July 5. But the actual report was released on July 3, 5 days before question was asked

What was correct way to react on it? 
According to resolution criteria: 
1) Report was released before validity period, so should not count 
2) Report was not released on July 3, so it was probably some other report.

Will official U.S. Navy sources publicly report that the USS Nimitz Carrier Strike Group has entered the Arabian Sea between 00:00:00 UTC on July 2, 2025 and 23:59:59 UTC on July 10, 2025? ==Further Information==: This question resolves to 'Yes' if, between 00:00:00 UTC on July 2, 2025 and 23:59:59 UTC on July 10, 2025, any official U.S. Navy source—such as press releases on Navy.mil, official U.S. Navy social media accounts, or statements from Navy spokespersons—publicly reports that any ship in the USS Nimitz Carrier Strike Group has entered the Arabian Sea (as defined by the International Hydrographic Organization’s boundaries in IHO Publication S-23). If no such public report is available by the deadline, the question resolves to 'No.'

Information validity period: 2025-07-02 00:00:00 UTC to 2025-07-10 23:59:59 UTC.

___ What is the purpose of such questions, that are being asked after the resolution criteria has occurred? 
Question was asked on the evening of July 7, but the resolution criteria was in the morning on same day https://news.usni.org/2025/07/07/usni-news-fleet-and-marine-tracker-july-7-2025

@infinite・6 

**We will be updating the weights associated to prediction intervals next week.** We will move from exponentially decreasing weights to** parabolically decreasing weights**. The purpose is to strike a balance between the fact that predicting gets increasingly hard as one moves away from the resolution time and that we want miners to update more frequently their predictions as new information comes in.
Asking the subnet potentially resolved or near resolved questions is a very valuable use case for prediction markets that we want to build upon.

Of course we are working on asking the most valuable questions, the fact that it is already resolved might be due to delays in the broadcasting pipeline. We are working on various metrics which will allow us to approximate the difficulty of a question.
How are those valuable?
Resolution on UMA is inefficient, it takes days and is prone to many errors.

# 🚀 Metaculus MiniBench Tournament integrates with Infinite Games

We're excited to announce that **Metaculus will be using our events and resolution signal in their upcoming MiniBench forecasting tournament**. They will be using our data alongside other public data sources such as **FRED, Yahoo Finance and Google Trends**. 

Our resolution data leverages subnet signal, and we use forecasts from our miners to tune event generation in terms of ambiguity and triviality. This marks **the first integration of our subnet API beyond web3**.

MiniBench is a series of bi-weekly $1k tournaments featuring ~60 questions each, starting September 1st, 2025. The fully automated format requires reliable, quality event generation and resolution at scale - exactly what our subnet provides autonomously.

# Release Notes

## [1.5.9] - 2025-09-02

- **Validator**: Enforce min Python version 3.11
- **Validator**: Use async subtensor and metagraph

# Introducing the Precog Index: A Multi-Layered Scoring for Forecasting Networks

@infinite・6 We're excited to announce the **Precog Index**, a **multi-layered scoring system** that addresses fundamental challenges in decentralised forecasting networks and ensures only original, well-calibrated, and genuinely valuable predictions are rewarded.

We expect the new scoring to **be live within the next two weeks**.

## The Problem

Traditional forecasting networks face three major vulnerabilities:

- **Sybil attacks** where a miner will register multiple identical models to game the system
- **Copy-trading** that rewards redundant information
- **Extremization techniques** designed to exploit scoring rules

Existing solutions like peer scoring and sequential rules break down under these real-world conditions, such as high frequency settlement or when Sybil attacks are possible.

## The Precog Index

 
**The index is funded upon a reference agent model: an online model is trained on all the miners' forecasts and weights each miner based on how much they improve the model's performance.** The online model is **seeded with the outputs of an internal forecaster**, thus miners are not judged only against each other but also against a strong forecasting baseline.

**The Precog Index enables several key capabilities**:

- **punish non-informative miners efficiently** and thus **lower the barrier to entry** for new miners
- **reward miners for their unique signal** - if a signal is redundant it won’t be rewarded
- **reward complementarity among forecasters** - one forecaster signal might only be valuable when aggregated with the signal from another forecaster
- **driving continuous improvement** by continually enhancing the forecasting baseline (i.e., the internal forecaster)

## To Miners

**Why we’re updating** 

- To focus incentives on signals that improve out-of-sample accuracy and support market execution.
- To ensure rewards reflect true, differentiated contribution to network performance.
- To reinforce a fair, durable framework that scales with our trading operations.

**What’s changing on a high level** 

- Scoring and rewards will place greater emphasis on log-loss optimization and out-of-sample contribution.
- Reward allocation will better recognize original, independent strategies and well-calibrated probabilities.
- System safeguards will reduce the impact of duplicative or low-value submissions.

**What this means for miners** 

- Rewards will increasingly track your marginal impact on the subnet’s predictive quality.
- Submissions that are well-calibrated and consistently useful to the aggregate forecast will be prioritized.
- Duplication (multiple miners with the same behavior) will see diminishing returns.

**How to position yourself as a miner** 

- Aim to minimize log loss on resolved events.
- Keep your probabilities well-calibrated (confidence should match reality over time).
- Maintain unique, independent strategies that add distinct value to the subnet.
- Favor steady, repeatable performance over one-off spikes.

It will most likely not get deregistered. With very fierce competition for the few top miners, there is very little incentive for established miners to aggressively buy bottom up, i.e., there is few regstration events around, and only the oldest miners are getting kicked out. 

Still, it is very hard to get any incentives.
Is it because the top miners are making precise predictions?

Please read about the new scoring here and tag @Marc to get official answers related to mining on the subnet

https://discord.com/channels/799672011265015819/1209554949449457705/1413538732170154004

Using the baseline miner from the repo will not bring you rewards, that is intended to speed up your setup. Then you have to contribute with your experience in developing forecasters to actually get you into incentives.
Makes sense. Is the new scoring system fully implemented? I wonder if I still need to submit predictions every 4 hours, and if they are all being tracked and calculated.
Yes and yes, you do need to answer the validators at least once for every 4h interval

Is the predictions needs to be updated every 4 hours? I wonder if I can cache the result for some periods like 8 hrs, 12 hrs, etc. I don't know if I'm doing this correct but making prediction using LLM every 4 hours for each event costs too much.

Well if your forecaster is very good, you can make only an initial prediction and then keep reusing that - I don’t have an answer to how often you should refresh; indeed every 4h might be too expensive and not bringing any prediction edge

I have no idea what impact each would have. I can only speculate that it would be more helpful to use some standard LLM(s) but provide it with the freshest news context about the event.
There is one outperforming miner with 0.61 incentive score. Is it because he's making precise prediction?
I wonder why this subnet has very little active miners. All the others failing to make predictions?

There are 200+ active miners, but less than 10 miners typically get rewards with the new scoring - only those who have useful and calibrated predictions 
Until 2 weeks ago, there were 100+ miners with incentives but many were redundant/copy miners with no useful output for our subnet metamodel
You can check the subnet dashboard to see the stats and reasons

@Marc @dani @MadMedian 
I am one of the best-performing miners, or at least I was, as I just lost my last of miner instances, which were still the best performers. Over the past year, I have delivered numerous high-quality predictions, with my miners occupying the #1 spot more frequently than any other miner. 

- With the new scoring system deployed, only 3-5 of all miners tend to earn *any* emissions. The rest gets 0.

- Whenever a new miner is registered, the oldest one among the zero-emission miners is removed.

- Each miner at the top stays there for about a day, as the scoring algorithm is very unstable given the existing questions/events' ecosystem.

Due to the above, a single actor took over the entire network with a fast-acting bot. This removed all the older, honest miners with high-quality predictions, and also made it impossible for new miners to be registered.
